title: A Jeff Koons 'balloon dog' sculpture was knocked over and shattered in Miami
description: The sculpture, valued at $42,000, was one of several balloon dog sculptures by the world-famous artist. Fortunately, it's covered by insurance.

title: Richard Belzer, stand-up comic and TV detective, dies at 78
description: Belzer was one of TV's most indelible detectives as John Munch in Homicide: Life on the Street and Law & Order: SVU.

title: Michigan State is set to resume classes following last week's mass shooting
description: Students are expected to return to class on Monday, one week after a gunman shot and killed three people, and injured five others, on campus.

title: Blinken tours Turkey's earthquake zone and pledges $100 million more in U.S. aid
description: The additional aid includes $50 million in emergency refugee and migration funds and $50 million in humanitarian assistance, Secretary of State Antony Blinken said.

title: UN talks to safeguard the world's marine biodiversity will pick back up this week
description: The goal of the U.N. meetings is to produce a unified agreement for the conservation and sustainable use of the world's vast marine ecosystems.

title: A Catholic bishop was found dead from a gunshot wound in California over the weekend
description: Auxiliary Bishop David O'Connell was born in Ireland and served as a priest and a bishop for more than four decades. The 69-year-old was remembered as a "peacemaker."

title: In 2022, Black farmers were persistently left behind from the USDA's loan system
description: An NPR data analysis shows Black farmers were accepted for USDA direct loans at a lower rate than other racial groups in 2022. Direct loans are supposed to be among the easiest for farmers to get.

title: 1 side owned slaves. The other side started Black History Month. How a family heals
description: In the U.S., what does it mean when a white family and a Black family share a last name — and one of their ancestors is a pioneer of Black history? How Black and white Woodsons became one family.

title: A visit to Nikki Haley's hometown — where race 'still exists'
description: Nikki Haley paints her hometown as a place where race was a reality, but not a limitation. But residents say some racial divisions still exist.

title: Andrew Lloyd Webber has written a new composition for Charles III's coronation
description: Andrew Lloyd Webber, the English composer who created the scores for blockbuster musicals such "The Phantom of the Opera'' and "Evita,'' has written the anthem for King Charles III's coronation.

title: The U.S. and South Korea staged a joint air exercise after the North's missile launch
description: North Korea said Sunday its latest intercontinental ballistic missile test was meant to further bolster its "fatal" nuclear attack capacity against its rivals.

title: After a year of war in Ukraine, all signs point to more misery with no end in sight
description: The first anniversary of the war arrives this week with few, if any, signs of a way out of the conflict. For the civilians caught in the crossfire, that means no discernible end to the suffering.

title: A kid in Guatemala had a dream. Today she's a disease detective
description: Neudy Rojop made a girlhood pledge. When family members fell ill, she says she decided to become a nurse "so I could change my community for good."

title: 4 takeaways from this year's important Munich Security Conference
description: The war in Ukraine dominated the annual conference in Germany, as Vice President Kamala Harris accused Russian forces of crimes against humanity.

title: One couple's bedroom caved in during the earthquake. Here's how it saved their lives
description: In the catastrophic earthquake in Turkey and Syria, several survivors stayed alive by chance when their collapsed walls provided protection.

title: A future NBA app feature lets fans virtually replace a player in a live game
description: A new streaming experience in the NBA app will let fans live out their Main Character dreams. League Commissioner Adam Silver announced the in-app additions this past week.

title: An American submarine that went missing in World War II is found off of Japan's coast
description: The wreckage of the USS Albacore, credited with sinking at least 10 enemy vessels during the war, was identified, the Navy said — almost 80 years after it was presumed lost.

title: Brittney Griner is headed back to the Phoenix Mercury, the AP reports
description: Griner has re-signed with the WNBA team on a one-year contract, a source told The Associated Press. The 32-year-old returned home from Russia in December after a high-level prisoner swap.
